title: DS220.03 Working With KillrVideo | Data Modeling with Apache Cassandra
description:
#DataStaxAcademy #DS220
DS220.03 Working With KillrVideo
To learn about Apache Cassandra data modeling, we will be using a movie domain for a sample application called KillrVideo. This unit will introduce you to the KillrVideo application.

LEARN FOR FREE at https://academy.datastax.com -- access all the FREE complete courses, tutorials, and hands-on exercises.

ASK QUESTIONS at https://community.datastax.com -- where experts from DataStax & the Apache Cassandra community share their expertise everyday.

transcript.text: [Music] to learn cassandra data modeling let's use a movie domain for a sample application called killer video killer video is a web application that allows users to create accounts and log in once logged into the site they can search for videos such as television shows or movies they can watch them and then respond by adding their own ratings and comments some of the challenges that killer video faces as a very successful application include the following first it needs to scale to support fast reads and writes even as more users and more content are added at the same time users expect the application to be highly available and the development team wants the application to be easy to manage and maintain so how will our data modeling choices affect those outcomes currently killer video stores its data in a relational database however the master slave architecture causes a single point of failure when the database crashes killer video also found that scaling the relational database is doable but difficult users on the other side of the world experience lag on the site simply because of their geographic location ideally the killer video team could store their data in both the eastern and western hemispheres so that all users can enjoy a pleasant viewing experience with no lag killer video plans to migrate to datastock's enterprise to address these problems dse groups nodes in a peer-to-peer fashion rather than a single centralized master slave database dse also scales linearly with the number of nodes killer video adds to the system dse is always on because when some nodes fail the other nodes can pick up the slack using dse killer video can easily locate its nodes geographically closer to each user's physical location now let's set up our environment so we can begin working on our new cassandra data model for killer video
